column4: hey help me please , http://www.tomshardware.co.uk/forum/page-250411_12_0.html  thanks . ( i have the same problem)
i tired memtest but no problems
so -- again: why would this be a Linux/Ubuntu issue?
which, BTW, you were told more than 3 times so far
OK. Why is it a problem only on Linux?
so (1) you start Windows, shutdown, restart, no problems; (2) you start Linux, shutdown, restart, you see the problem?
and shutdown on Windows -- is there a problem on reboot?
it does not sound like power, or memory issue
it sounds more like your BIOS is slightly hosed/bad. Did you upgrade the BIOS recently?

: and more something . IF I DISABLE " SAFEWATCHDOG " FROM THE BIOS, obviously the error message is not displayed BUT the OS doesn't boot at all and the monitor doesn't recive more signal and go to stand-by...
: my bios is up to date .
did you update the BIOS recently?
did you have the same problem with the previous BIOS version?

: and more something . IF I DISABLE " SAFEWATCHDOG " FROM THE BIOS, obviously the error message is not displayed BUT the OS doesn't boot at all and the monitor doesn't recive more signal and go to stand-by...
: i dont remember i tired to install the old bios and still problem
did you try the BIOS recovery process in here: http://support.intel.com/support/motherboards/desktop/sb/CS-028780.htm
